lines.gurmukhi: jYsy niRp Dwm Bwm eyk sY AiDk eyk nwiek Anyk rwjw sBn lfwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Nrip Dhaam Bhaam Ayk Sai Adhik Ayka , Naaik Anayk Raajaa Sabhan Ladaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As a king has many queens in his palace, each of remarkable beauty, he cajoles and pampers each one of them;

lines.gurmukhi: jnmq jw kY suqu vwhI kY suhwgu Bwgu skl rwnI mY ptrwnI so khwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Janamat Jaa Kai Soutu Vaahee Kai Suhaagu Bhaagu , Sakal Raanee Mai Pataraanee So Kahaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One who bears him a son enjoys higher status in the palace and is declared as the chief among the queens;

lines.gurmukhi: Asn bsn ishjwsn sMjogI sbY rwj AiDkwru qau spUqI giH AwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Asan Basan Sihajaasan Sanjogee Sabai , Raaj Adhikaaru Tau Sapootee Grih Aavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Each one of them has the right and opportunities to enjoy the pleasures of the palace and share the bed of the king;

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK sbY guru crin srin ilv gurisK sMiD imly inj pdu pwveI ]120]
lines.transliteration_english: Gursikh Sabai Guru Charani Sarani Liva , Gursikh Sandhi Milay Nij Padu Paavaee ?120?

Shabad OS B.translation: So do the Guru's Sikhs assemble in the refuge of the True Guru. But he who meets with the Lord after losing his self reaches the realm of spiritual peace and comfort. (120)
